keyword: how many calories in an ipa
title: How Many Calories in an IPA?
meta_description: Learn how many calories in an IPA with a full nutrition breakdown, including carbs, protein, and tweaks for different styles—based on a standard 12 oz serving.
h1: How Many Calories in an IPA?
assumptions: Standard 12 oz (355 ml) serving of India Pale Ale beer, average ABV 6.5%, no added flavors or mixers.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, ABV, serving size, brewing method, and exact recipe. Check labels or brewery info when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard 12 oz IPA contains about 220 calories, mostly from alcohol and carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison with beverage labels.

tweaks.label: Switch to a light IPA (lower ABV ~4.5%)

faqs.q: How many calories in an IPA beer?
faqs.a: About 220 kcal for a standard 12 oz IPA.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in one IPA?
faqs.a: Roughly 18 g of carbohydrates per 12 oz serving.

faqs.q: Do IPAs have protein or fat?
faqs.a: Minimal—about 1.5 g protein and 0 g fat per serving.

faqs.q: How does ABV affect calories in an IPA?
faqs.a: Higher ABV increases calories due to more alcohol; light IPAs are lower.

faqs.q: Calories in a pint of IPA vs. bottle?
faqs.a: A 16 oz pint adds about 50-60 kcal more than a 12 oz bottle.
